poker.calculator

Interface PokerCalculator

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    Simulator

    public interface PokerCalculator
    The user of this interface can calculate the equity of two poker hands.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void calculateEquity(java.lang.String hand1, java.lang.String hand2)
      Calculates the equity of two hands.
      double equity1()
      Returns the equity of the first hand.
      double equity2()
      Returns the equity of the second hand.

    • Method Detail

      • calculateEquity

        void calculateEquity(java.lang.String hand1,
                   java.lang.String hand2)
        Calculates the equity of two hands. Equity is defined as winning percentage + tie percentage / 2. For example, if the pot size is 100 and the equity is 60 %, it means that the expected stack size is 0.6*100=60.
        Parameters:
        hand1 - string expression of the first hand
        hand2 - string expression of the second hand

      • equity1

        double equity1()
        Returns the equity of the first hand.
        Returns:
        the equity expressed as a decimal number

      • equity2

        double equity2()
        Returns the equity of the second hand.
        Returns:
        the equity expressed as a decimal number
